title: "Items" font?
content: The only font I could find with this ligature is Emigrï¿½'s Mrs Eaves. See [this page of ligatures](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124613/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PMESLigR.html).
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
However, when I try comparing the two, this is clearly not Mrs Eaves. It's probably a Garamond, looking at the 'e' and 's', but my books don't show all the ligatures.   
 ![Mrs Eaves ligature comparison](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124613im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33571.gif)
Looks kind of Caslon-ish to me, but I'm coming up empty handed.

Although it's not a match for the example above, Letraset's [Eplica](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/eplica/) also sports 'il and 'it' ligatures in this style.   
   
 ![Letraset Eplica Book Ligatures](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124613im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33710.gif)
